newsitem.title: USA: Rada shareholder seeks to enjoin meeting.
newsitem.headline: Rada shareholder seeks to enjoin meeting.

text.p: Rada Electronic Industries Ltd said Monday a shareholder has initiated an action in Israel to enjoin the company's Annual General Meeting of Shareholders scheduled for December 20 from taking place.
The shareholder, Imaginative Business and Marketing Ltd, has objected to the meeting going forward without it being able to vote. A hearing on this matter is scheduled in Tel Aviv on Wednesday.
Rada said the record date, Nov 21, was established on Oct 22, long before it was notified that this shareholder was going to convert a note into ordinary shares.

IBML, a Gibraltar corporation, acquired 1,146,758 ordinary shares, about 15 percent of Rada's outstanding shares, when it exercised the conversion provisions of a convertible note on November 27, the company noted.
After notifying the company of its exercise, IBML has made various demands on the company, including board control, Rada said. Its directors believe the IBML's actions are without any merit.
To date, IBML has not filed a Schedule 13D with the Company or the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission providing pertinent data about itself.

A representative of IBML has asked management to call for an extraordinary meeting of shareholders to be held in early January for the purpose of amending the provisions in the company's articles of association providing for the election of directors on a staggered basis.
